00023 #ifndef __BMESH_WALKERS_H__
00024 #define __BMESH_WALKERS_H__
00025 
00030 #include "BLI_ghash.h"
00031 
00032 /*
00033  * NOTE: do NOT modify topology while walking a mesh!
00034  */
00035 
00036 typedef enum {
00037     BMW_DEPTH_FIRST,
00038     BMW_BREADTH_FIRST
00039 } BMWOrder;
00040 
00041 typedef enum {
00042     BMW_FLAG_NOP = 0,
00043     BMW_FLAG_TEST_HIDDEN = (1 << 0)
00044 } BMWFlag;
00045 
00046 /*Walkers*/
00047 typedef struct BMWalker {
00048     void  (*begin) (struct BMWalker *walker, void *start);
00049     void *(*step)  (struct BMWalker *walker);
00050     void *(*yield) (struct BMWalker *walker);
00051     int structsize;
00052     BMWOrder order;
00053     int valid_mask;
00054 
00055     /* runtime */
00056     int layer;
00057 
00058     BMesh *bm;
00059     BLI_mempool *worklist;
00060     ListBase states;
00061 
00062     /* these masks are to be tested against elements BMO_elem_flag_test(),
00063      * should never be accessed directly only through BMW_init() and bmw_mask_check_*() functions */
00064     short mask_vert;
00065     short mask_edge;
00066     short mask_face;
00067 
00068     BMWFlag flag;
00069 
00070     GHash *visithash;
00071     GHash *secvisithash;
00072     int depth;
00073 } BMWalker;
00074 
00075 /* define to make BMW_init more clear */
00076 #define BMW_MASK_NOP 0
00077 
00078 /* initialize a walker.  searchmask restricts some (not all) walkers to
00079  * elements with a specific tool flag set.  flags is specific to each walker.*/
00080 void BMW_init(struct BMWalker *walker, BMesh *bm, int type,
00081               short mask_vert, short mask_edge, short mask_face,
00082               BMWFlag flag,
00083               int layer);
00084 void *BMW_begin(BMWalker *walker, void *start);
00085 void *BMW_step(struct BMWalker *walker);
00086 void  BMW_end(struct BMWalker *walker);
00087 int   BMW_current_depth(BMWalker *walker);
00088 
00089 /*these are used by custom walkers*/
00090 void *BMW_current_state(BMWalker *walker);
00091 void *BMW_state_add(BMWalker *walker);
00092 void  BMW_state_remove(BMWalker *walker);
00093 void *BMW_walk(BMWalker *walker);
00094 void  BMW_reset(BMWalker *walker);
00095 
00096 /*
00097  * example of usage, walking over an island of tool flagged faces:
00098  *
00099  * BMWalker walker;
00100  * BMFace *f;
00101  *
00102  * BMW_init(&walker, bm, BMW_ISLAND, SOME_OP_FLAG);
00103  * f = BMW_begin(&walker, some_start_face);
00104  * for (; f; f = BMW_step(&walker))
00105  * {
00106  *     //do something with f
00107  * }
00108  * BMW_end(&walker);
00109  */
00110 
00111 enum {
00112     /* walk over connected geometry.  can restrict to a search flag,
00113      * or not, it's optional.
00114      *
00115      * takes a vert as an argument, and spits out edges, restrict flag acts
00116      * on the edges as well. */
00117     BMW_SHELL,
00118     /*walk over an edge loop.  search flag doesn't do anything.*/
00119     BMW_LOOP,
00120     BMW_FACELOOP,
00121     BMW_EDGERING,
00122     /* #define BMW_RING 2 */
00123     /* walk over uv islands; takes a loop as input.  restrict flag
00124      * restricts the walking to loops whose vert has restrict flag set as a
00125      * tool flag.
00126      *
00127      * the flag parameter to BMW_init maps to a loop customdata layer index.
00128      */
00129     BMW_LOOPDATA_ISLAND,
00130     /* walk over an island of flagged faces.  note, that this doesn't work on
00131      * non-manifold geometry.  it might be better to rewrite this to extract
00132      * boundary info from the island walker, rather then directly walking
00133      * over the boundary.  raises an error if it encounters nonmanifold
00134      * geometry. */
00135     BMW_ISLANDBOUND,
00136     /* walk over all faces in an island of tool flagged faces. */
00137     BMW_ISLAND,
00138     /* walk from a vertex to all connected vertices. */
00139     BMW_CONNECTED_VERTEX,
00140     /* end of array index enum vals */
00141 
00142     /* do not intitialze function pointers and struct size in BMW_init */
00143     BMW_CUSTOM,
00144     BMW_MAXWALKERS
00145 };
00146 
00147 /* use with BMW_init, so as not to confuse with restrict flags */
00148 #define BMW_NIL_LAY  0
00149 
00150 #endif /* __BMESH_WALKERS_H__ */
